summary: This is a CNN news article reporting on a press conference held by attorney Bradley Edwards, who represents dozens of Jeffrey Epstein's accusers. Edwards alleges that Epstein had improper sexual contact with at least one woman while serving his 2008-2009 jail sentence and continued inappropriate contact with women as recently as 2011. The article also covers new accusers coming forward in New York and an investigation in New Mexico.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy; accused of continuing improper sexual contact while serving a jail sentence and up to 2011.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Lawyer representing dozens of Epstein accusers; held a press conference alleging Epstein had improper sexual contact while in jail and up to 2011, and revealed new accusers in New York.

persons.name: Kara Scannell
persons.context: Co-author of the CNN news article.

persons.name: Madeleine Ayer
persons.context: Co-author of the CNN news article.

persons.name: Curt Devine
persons.context: Co-author of the CNN news article.

persons.name: Hector Balderas
persons.context: His office is investigating allegations that Epstein committed additional sex crimes in New Mexico.

persons.name: Matt Baca
persons.role: Spokesperson for New Mexico Attorney General
persons.context: Spokesperson for AG Hector Balderas; stated authorities have interviewed at least two individuals alleging abuse by Epstein in New Mexico.

connections.description: Edwards is an attorney representing dozens of individuals accusing Epstein of sexual abuse and misconduct.
Balderas's office (New Mexico Attorney General) is investigating allegations that Epstein committed sex crimes in New Mexico.

events.title: Bradley Edwards Press Conference
events.description: Attorney Bradley Edwards held a press conference in New York alleging Jeffrey Epstein had improper sexual contact with at least one woman while serving his jail sentence and continued inappropriate contact up to 2011.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Jail Sentence
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state prostitution-related charges and began serving a 13-month jail sentence, during which he was allowed to work at an office.

events.title: Federal Charges in New York
events.description: Federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York charged Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Scheduled Bail Hearing
events.description: A bail hearing was set for Thursday (July 18, 2019) where Epstein's attorneys argued for his release under conditions including confinement to his New York mansion.

events.title: New Accusers Come Forward in New York
events.description: Five new accusers alleged they were assaulted by Epstein in New York, coming forward after federal charges were announced.

events.title: New Mexico Investigation Interviews
events.description: Within the four months prior to July 2019, New Mexico authorities interviewed at least two individuals alleging abuse by Epstein at his ranch, with more coming forward after the federal indictment.

keyFacts: Attorney Bradley Edwards alleges Jeffrey Epstein had 'improper sexual contact' with at least one woman while serving his 2008-2009 jail sentence, during his permitted work release.
Edwards alleges Epstein had inappropriate contact with women as recently as 2011, contradicting his lawyers' claims of a 'spotless 14-year record' since his 2008 plea.
Five new accusers have come forward alleging assaults by Epstein in New York following the federal sex trafficking charges.
The New Mexico Attorney General's office is investigating allegations of sex crimes by Epstein at his ranch near Santa Fe and has interviewed at least two alleged victims.
Epstein's attorneys were seeking his release on bail with conditions including confinement to his New York mansion and a tracking device, with a hearing scheduled for July 18, 2019.
